comments:
See attached screen capture.  Note that none of the existing java projects have CVS connections, and 
the "Team Share" perspective has no entries.

After creating the "abbot" project I did establish a CVS connection but later disconnected it (via Team-
>Disconnect context menu).  The connection was to sourceforge (abbot.sf.net), using :ext: connections 
both with /usr/bin/ssh and extssh mapped to the :ext: protocol (neither ended up working 
satisfactorily, but that's a different bug).

Now during every launch/build, the dialog appears with one or more of the displayed error in it.
Created an attachment (id=19739)
screen shot of CVS error dialog
Could you please attach the error log file (the .log file found in 
the .metadata directory of your workspace)? 

The error is not the result of an attempted connection. It is a processing 
error mot likely related to the Synchronize view. The error log will hopefully 
have more details about the error.
Created an attachment (id=19743)
.metadata/.log
Here's the CVS error. Have you modified your install in any way? This type of 
error should be caught by the compiler. However, the CVS code compiles fine 
which means it is most likely a VM issue.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Apr 09, 2005 12:12:41.532
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Reconciling CVS state changes".
!STACK 0
java.lang.AbstractMethodError: 
org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.dispatchEvents
(Lorg/eclipse/core/runtime/IProgressMonitor;)V
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.processEvents
(BackgroundEventHandler.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler$1.run
(BackgroundEventHandler.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

There are really two issues here: The first is the error itself. As I said, 
this appears to be a VM issue and there is not much I can do about that. The 
second is that CVS operations are running on disconnected projects. This is 
probably a side effect of auto-connection (or reconnection in this case). I 
have added a preference to disable auto-sharing (and I'm marking this bu fixed 
to reflect that).
The only mods I would have made would have been to use the software update utility (probably to go 
from 3.0.1 to 3.0.2, but I can't be certain).  java reports the following:

java version "1.4.2_05"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_05-141.4)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-38, mixed mode)
